importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the plane crash, which occurred on September 18, 2025, is central to the incident, marking when the fatal event took place and triggering the NTSB investigation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The article was updated at 5:44 PM EDT on October 20, 2025, indicating when the latest information on the crash and NTSB report was made public.

keyTakeAways: Brett James, a Grammy-winning songwriter, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, in Franklin, North Carolina.
The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) reported that the plane entered a 'tightening spiral' during its flight and crashed.
All three people on board the Cirrus SR22T were killed in the incident.
James had requested a visual approach to runway 7, which was approved by air traffic control.
James failed to change the radio frequency from the common traffic advisory frequency to the one assigned for runway approach communications.
The controller attempted to communicate that James had not changed the frequency, but there were no further communications.
The plane flew over runway 7, executed a left turn, and descended before entering a spiral and crashing.
NTSB investigators found no mechanical problems with the aircraft.

Brett James was a prominent songwriter known for collaborations with Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, including co-writing 'Out Last Night' and 'Jesus, Take the Wheel' for Carrie Underwood.
His song 'Jesus, Take the Wheel' was a breakout hit in 2005 following Carrie Underwood’s rise from 'American Idol'.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Grammy-winning songwriter Brett James, 57, died in a plane crash on September 18, 2025, in Franklin, North Carolina, while attempting to land on runway 7. The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) found that James’s plane entered a 'tightening spiral' due to a failure to change from the common traffic advisory frequency to the correct one for approach, leading to loss of communication and a fatal descent. All three people on board were killed. The Cirrus SR22T aircraft showed no mechanical issues. James was a highly sought-after songwriter with major collaborations including Taylor Swift, Bon Jovi, Keith Urban, and Kenny Chesney, notably co-writing 'Jesus, Take the Wheel' for Carrie Underwood and 'Out Last Night'.
title: Songwriter Brett James’ plane entered a ‘tightening spiral’ before crashing, the NTSB said in a preliminary report
